title: Java Level 8 — Recursion & Algorithms
concept: Recursive functions, backtracking-lite, slightly harder array/string logic.

challenges.name: Recursive Factorial
challenges.description: Implement factorial using recursion and print n!.

challenges.name: Recursive Fibonacci
challenges.description: Implement Fibonacci using recursion (memoization recommended to avoid TLE). Print nth Fibonacci (F1=0, F2=1).
challenges.notes: Better to implement iterative or memoized.

challenges.name: Sum of Digits (Recursion)
challenges.description: Given non-negative integer n, recursively compute sum of its digits.

challenges.name: Binary Search (Recursive)
challenges.description: Given sorted array and value x, implement recursive binary search. Print index (0-based) or -1.
challenges.input_format: n, array of n sorted ints, then x.

challenges.name: Generate All Subsets (Bitmask Count Only)
challenges.description: Given n (n ≤ 20), count how many subsets of {1..n} have even sum. Use recursion or bitmasks.

challenges.name: String Permutation Check
challenges.description: Given two strings s and t, check if t is a permutation of s (same multiset of characters). Print YES or NO.

challenges.name: Balanced Parentheses
challenges.description: Given a string of brackets ()[]{}, check if it is balanced using stack. Print YES or NO.

challenges.name: Subset Sum Exists
challenges.description: Given n and n numbers and target S (n ≤ 20), determine recursively if there exists subset whose sum is S. Print YES or NO.
challenges.input_format: n, then n integers, then S.

challenges.name: String Compression
challenges.description: Given string s, compress consecutive repeating characters as char followed by count (e.g., aaabb -> a3b2). If compressed string is not shorter, print original.

challenges.name: Longest Common Prefix
challenges.description: Given n strings, find the longest common prefix. If none, print "" (empty line).
challenges.input_format: First line: n. Next n lines: strings.
